items.text: There are times when I feel so anxious that I cannot leave my house without great effort.
items.rationale: Severe anxiety with agoraphobic features is a core clinical syndrome (Anxiety Disorder) assessed by the MCMI.

items.text: I have periods where I drink far more alcohol than I should, and I can't seem to stop once I start.
items.rationale: Alcohol dependence is directly assessed as a clinical syndrome on the MCMI.

items.text: Sometimes I hear voices that other people tell me aren't really there.
items.rationale: Auditory hallucinations map to the Thought Disorder / Major Depression with psychotic features severe clinical syndrome scales.

items.text: I have gone through weeks where I felt so sad and hopeless that nothing seemed worth doing.
items.rationale: Persistent depressed mood and hopelessness are hallmarks of the Dysthymia and Major Depression clinical syndrome scales.

items.text: I have used drugs to the point where it has caused serious problems in my relationships and work.
items.rationale: Drug dependence with functional impairment is a core clinical syndrome on the MCMI.

items.text: I sometimes feel a sudden rush of panic with my heart pounding and a sense that I might die.
items.rationale: Panic attacks with somatic symptoms and catastrophic cognitions are central to the Anxiety clinical syndrome scale.

items.text: There have been times when I couldn't remember important things about my life, as if whole periods just disappeared.
items.rationale: Dissociative amnesia maps to the Thought Disorder severe clinical syndrome and somatoform features.

items.text: I have had episodes where I barely slept for days, felt incredibly energized, and made reckless decisions.
items.rationale: Manic episodes with decreased sleep, grandiosity, and impulsivity map to the Bipolar: Manic clinical syndrome scale.

items.text: I frequently have physical complaints—headaches, stomach problems, pain—that doctors can't fully explain.
items.rationale: Unexplained somatic complaints are assessed by the Somatoform clinical syndrome scale.

items.text: I have had thoughts of ending my life and have sometimes made plans to do so.
items.rationale: Suicidal ideation with planning is a severe indicator captured across Major Depression and other clinical syndrome scales.

items.text: I often feel that people are plotting against me or watching me for reasons I can't explain.
items.rationale: Paranoid ideation and persecutory beliefs map to the Thought Disorder and Delusional Disorder severe clinical syndrome scales.

items.text: I have experienced traumatic events that still cause me nightmares and flashbacks on a regular basis.
items.rationale: Re-experiencing symptoms of trauma map to the Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder clinical syndrome scale.

items.text: I sometimes feel detached from my own body, as though I'm watching myself from the outside.
items.rationale: Depersonalization can reflect clinical syndromes such as anxiety or thought disorder, but also overlaps with schizotypal personality patterns.

items.text: My mood can shift dramatically within a single day, from feeling on top of the world to utter despair.
items.rationale: Rapid mood cycling suggests bipolar or dysthymic clinical syndromes but could also reflect borderline personality pattern.

items.text: I often feel tense and on edge, and I worry constantly about things that others say are minor.
items.rationale: Chronic worry and tension map to the Anxiety clinical syndrome but also overlap with the Avoidant and Dependent personality patterns characterized by pervasive apprehension.

items.text: I answered every question on this form honestly and did not try to make myself look better or worse.
items.rationale: This directly assesses response honesty, mapping to the Disclosure and Desirability modifying indices.

items.text: I don't think I have any real faults that are worth mentioning.
items.rationale: Denial of any personal faults is a classic indicator of social desirability bias captured by the Desirability index.

items.text: I have never told a lie, not even a small one.
items.rationale: An implausibly virtuous claim is a validity check item designed to detect faking good on the Desirability scale.

items.text: Everything in my life is going wrong, and I can't think of a single good thing about myself.
items.rationale: Extreme global negativity suggests exaggeration or a cry for help, captured by the Debasement modifying index.

items.text: I am the worst person I know, and I deserve every bad thing that happens to me.
items.rationale: Extreme self-debasement beyond typical depressive cognition flags the Debasement index for over-reporting pathology.

items.text: I found it very difficult to understand many of the questions on this test.
items.rationale: Difficulty comprehending items may indicate random or careless responding, flagged by the Validity index.

items.text: I have never felt angry at anyone, even when they treated me unfairly.
items.rationale: Denial of a universal human emotion is a marker of impression management on the Desirability scale.

items.text: I tried to be as open as possible when answering these questions, even when it was uncomfortable.
items.rationale: Self-reported openness in responding maps to the Disclosure modifying index assessing willingness to reveal personal information.

items.text: I feel like nothing I say on this questionnaire could capture how terrible my problems really are.
items.rationale: Feeling that the test underestimates one's suffering suggests symptom amplification captured by the Debasement index.

items.text: People who know me would say I always present myself in the best possible light.
items.rationale: Third-person observation of impression management directly maps to the Desirability modifying index.

items.text: I marked some answers without really reading the questions because I wanted to finish quickly.
items.rationale: Admission of careless responding is directly relevant to the Validity modifying index.

items.text: I tend to keep my personal problems to myself and would rather not share them on a questionnaire like this.
items.rationale: Reluctance to disclose maps to low scores on the Disclosure modifying index.

items.text: I feel so overwhelmed by my problems that I may have exaggerated some of my answers.
items.rationale: Acknowledged exaggeration due to distress maps to Debasement but could also reflect genuine severe clinical syndrome distress.

items.text: I generally get along well with everyone and rarely have conflicts with others.
items.rationale: While this could reflect genuine agreeableness, the sweeping positive self-portrayal may indicate Desirability bias; some ambiguity with compulsive or dependent personality patterns.

items.text: I believe I am completely worthless and have nothing to offer anyone.
items.rationale: Extreme worthlessness could reflect genuine Major Depression (Clinical Syndrome) or symptom exaggeration captured by the Debasement modifying index.

items.text: I have always needed a lot of reassurance and guidance from others before making decisions.
items.rationale: Chronic dependency on others for decision-making is a core feature of the Dependent personality pattern.

items.text: I tend to avoid social situations because I'm certain people will criticize or reject me.
items.rationale: Social avoidance driven by fear of rejection is the hallmark of the Avoidant personality pattern.

items.text: I believe I am a truly special person and that most people don't appreciate my unique talents.
items.rationale: Grandiosity and a sense of being exceptional map directly to the Narcissistic personality pattern.

items.text: I have gotten into trouble many times because I act on impulse without thinking about the consequences.
items.rationale: Chronic impulsivity with repeated negative consequences is a defining feature of the Antisocial personality pattern.

items.text: I am extremely careful about following rules and doing things the right way, even when others think I'm being too rigid.
items.rationale: Rigidity, rule-adherence, and perfectionism are core features of the Compulsive personality pattern.

items.text: I often go along with what others want, even when I secretly resent it, and then I find indirect ways to express my frustration.
items.rationale: Surface compliance with covert resentment and indirect expression of anger defines the Negativistic (Passive-Aggressive) personality pattern.

items.text: I prefer to be alone most of the time and don't really care about having close relationships.
items.rationale: Social indifference and preference for solitude are hallmarks of the Schizoid personality pattern.

items.text: I enjoy being the center of attention and feel uncomfortable when I'm not noticed.
items.rationale: Attention-seeking behavior and discomfort when not the focus map to the Histrionic personality pattern.

items.text: I have always felt that I deserve to be punished and that suffering is a natural part of my life.
items.rationale: Self-defeating beliefs and acceptance of suffering as deserved map to the Masochistic (Self-Defeating) personality pattern.

items.text: I find it satisfying to dominate and control others, and I don't mind using intimidation to get what I want.
items.rationale: Enjoyment of dominance and willingness to intimidate are core features of the Sadistic (Aggressive) personality pattern.

items.text: My relationships are intense and unstable—I idealize people one moment and feel completely betrayed by them the next.
items.rationale: Splitting, idealization-devaluation cycles, and relationship instability are defining features of the Borderline personality pattern.

items.text: I have unusual beliefs and experiences that others find strange, like sensing things before they happen.
items.rationale: Magical thinking and unusual perceptual experiences are core features of the Schizotypal personality pattern.

items.text: I feel deeply suspicious of other people's motives and am always on guard against being exploited.
items.rationale: Pervasive suspiciousness maps to the Paranoid personality pattern, but could also reflect clinical-level paranoid ideation under Clinical Syndromes (Thought Disorder).

items.text: I often feel empty inside and will do almost anything to avoid being abandoned by someone I care about.
items.rationale: Chronic emptiness and abandonment fears are central to the Borderline personality pattern, but the abandonment fear also overlaps with the Dependent pattern.

items.text: I have long periods where I feel deeply sad about myself and believe I am fundamentally flawed as a person.
items.rationale: Chronic self-deprecation and sadness could reflect the Depressive personality pattern or the Dysthymia/Major Depression clinical syndrome scales.
